params.name: COMMAND
params.default_value:
#!/bin/bash
#
# Following code will use active deploy to deploy the new application.
# Code used is available at https://github.com/Osthanes/update_service
# and https://github.com/Osthanes/activedeploy_common
#
# For details how to use and configure this active deploy toolchain extension, see
# https://console.ng.bluemix.net/docs/services/ActiveDeploy/updatingapps.html#adpipeline
#
# Feel free to fork the code and define environment variable GIT_HOME to use your forked code from
# https://github.com/${GIT_HOME}/update_service and https://github.com/${GIT_HOME}/activedeploy_common
#
# Make sure following variables are defined as environment properties with no values
# - NAME : Name of new application (Has to be exported in the previous job)
# - TEST_RESULT_FOR_AD : Variable used to pass the test result of the test phase to the complete phase of active deploy (Has to be set in the test job)
#
# Following variables may be defined as environment properties
# - GROUP_SIZE : Number of instances which are created during initial deployment. Default is 1
# - CONCURRENT_VERSIONS: Number of additional application versions to keep at the end of deployment. Default is 1
#

source ${EXT_DIR}/git_util.sh
git_retry clone https://github.com/IBMActiveDeploy-Toolchain/update_service.git activedeploy
activedeploy/activedeploy_step_1.sh

execution.shell:
#!/bin/bash

set +e
[[ ${DEBUG_EXTENSION} -eq 1 ]] && set -x
export RAMPUP_DURATION=#RAMPUP_DURATION#
export RAMPDOWN_DURATION=#RAMPDOWN_DURATION#
export DEPLOYMENT_METHOD="#DEPLOYMENT_METHOD#"
export INIT_START_TIME=$(date +"%s")
GIT_HOME=${GIT_HOME:-"Osthanes"}
[[ "${GIT_HOME}" == "Osthanes" && "${IDS_URL}" == *"stage1"* ]] && GIT_HOME="IBMActiveDeploy-Toolchain"
export GIT_HOME
# OSSC line
dpkg -l | grep '^ii' > $EXT_DIR/pkglist
. $EXT_DIR/_init.sh
# OSSC line
dpkg -l | grep '^ii' > $EXT_DIR/pkglist2
if [[ $DEBUG -eq 1 ]]; then
  diff $EXT_DIR/pkglist $EXT_DIR/pkglist2 || true
fi
INIT_END_TIME=$(date +"%s")
INIT_EST_TIME=$(($INIT_END_TIME-$INIT_START_TIME))
echo -e "Init runtime of `date -u -d @"$INIT_EST_TIME" +'%-Mm %-Ss'`"
# place command into a temp script file
cat > script.sh << '__EOF__'
#!/bin/bash
function save_env_vars_on_exit() {
    echo "#!/bin/bash" > $EXT_DIR/save_vars.sh
    export -p >> $EXT_DIR/save_vars.sh
}
trap "save_env_vars_on_exit" EXIT
#COMMAND#
__EOF__
# call the script in a subscript
[[ ${DEBUG_EXTENSION} -eq 1 ]] && cat script.sh
/bin/bash -e script.sh
PIPE_SCR_RESULT=$?
# restore the saved exported vars
source $EXT_DIR/save_vars.sh
if [ $PIPE_SCR_RESULT -ne 0 ]; then
    exit $PIPE_SCR_RESULT
fi
[[ ${DEBUG_EXTENSION} -eq 1 ]] && set +x
